card001.description: Understand the importance of Yin-Yang balance as the foundation of health in traditional Chinese medicine.
card001.title: Yin-Yang Theory

card002.description: Explore the interactions of the Five Elements and their effects on the body and mind.
card002.title: Five Elements Theory

card003.description: Learn about the Zang-Fu organs and their role in maintaining balance and health.
card003.title: Zang-Fu Theory

card004.description: Discover the meridian system, the channels that connect the body and facilitate the flow of Qi.
card004.title: Meridian System

card005.description: Understand the causes and mechanisms of diseases according to traditional Chinese medicine.
card005.title: Etiology and Pathogenesis

card006.description: Learn practical tips for preserving health through diet, lifestyle, and seasonal adjustments.
card006.title: Health Preservation

card011.description: Consume foods like astragalus, codonopsis, and jujube to boost Qi. Prevent fatigue, shortness of breath, and susceptibility to illness.
card011.title: Qi Deficiency Health Tips

card012.description: Eat foods like angelica, goji berries, and black sesame to nourish blood. Prevent anemia, dizziness, and pale complexion.
card012.title: Blood Deficiency Health Tips

card013.description: Consume warming foods like lamb, ginger, and cinnamon to strengthen Yang. Prevent cold intolerance, poor digestion, and fatigue.
card013.title: Yang Deficiency Health Tips

card014.description: Eat foods like white fungus, lily bulbs, and goji berries to nourish Yin. Prevent night sweats, dry mouth, and insomnia.
card014.title: Yin Deficiency Health Tips

card021.description: Consume fiber-rich and antioxidant foods like oats, apples, and grapes. Control fat and salt intake, maintain moderate exercise, and avoid overexertion.
card021.title: Cardiovascular Disease Prevention

card022.description: Eat mild and easily digestible foods like millet porridge, yam, and pumpkin. Eat at regular intervals, avoid overeating, and manage stress.
card022.title: Digestive System Disease Prevention

card023.description: Consume lung-nourishing foods like pears, white fungus, and lily bulbs. Avoid getting cold, monitor air quality, and engage in regular outdoor activities.
card023.title: Respiratory System Disease Prevention

card031.description: Consume collagen-rich and antioxidant foods like pig's trotters, fish maw, and goji berries. Ensure adequate sleep, reduce UV exposure, and supplement with vitamin C.
card031.title: Beauty and Skincare

card032.description: Eat low-fat, high-fiber foods like oats, green tea, and vegetables. Maintain regular exercise, control portion sizes, and avoid high-calorie snacks.
card032.title: Weight Loss

card033.description: Consume vitamin C and zinc-rich foods like citrus fruits, nuts, and milk. Exercise regularly, maintain a positive mindset, and ensure adequate sleep.
card033.title: Immune System Boost

hero: Your Best Chinese Medicine Wellness Tips

card041.description: Eat warming foods like onion, ginger, and garlic to boost Yang energy. Prevent colds and allergies, and take care of your liver.
card041.title: Spring Health Tips

card042.description: Consume cooling foods like mung beans, bitter melon, and watermelon. Prevent heatstroke and digestive issues, and stay hydrated.
card042.title: Summer Health Tips

card043.description: Eat nourishing foods like pears, white fungus, and lily bulbs. Prevent dryness-related issues like respiratory problems and dry skin.
card043.title: Autumn Health Tips

card044.description: Consume warming foods like lamb, goji berries, and red dates. Prevent cold-related illnesses and maintain kidney health.
card044.title: Winter Health Tips
